Chapter 11 Problem Set 1 11.1 Estimating model parameters 11.2 Estimate \(R^2\) and \(\bar{R^2}\) 11.3 Simulation study

Chapter 11 Problem Set 1 The model used in the simulation has the following structure: \[x_{i1}=1, x_{i2}:x_{i10} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\] \[y_{i}=\mathbf{x}_i'\boldsymbol{\beta}+\varepsilon\] with \(\boldsymbol{\beta}=\left(\begin{matrix} 1&0.5 &0&0& 0& 0& 0& 0& 0& 0& 0 \end{matrix}\right)\) and \(\varepsilon \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\) and \(n=1000\). 11.1 Estimating model parameters Calculate \(\hat{\boldsymbol{\beta}}\), \(\hat{\mathbf{y}}\) and \(\hat{\boldsymbol{\varepsilon}}\) and the standard errors of the coefficient estimates. Please try to program these entities yourself instead of using pre-specified functions in R. 11.2 Estimate \(R^2\) and \(\bar{R^2}\) Calculate both the \(R^2\) and the adjusted \(R^2\) for one draw of the covariates and the full model specification. 11.3 Simulation study In a suitably designed simulation, show the behaviour of the \(R^2\) and the adjusted \(R^2\) when starting only with a constant and add covariates sequentially to the model.
